clinical_study.official_title: Investigating the Quality of Recovery After Childbirth

brief_summary.textblock: In this proposed study, the investigators hope to assess the quality of recovery after delivery in a local population that would take into account physiological and psychological parameters to better understand the recovery process after delivery. The investigators will identify risk factors, especially those that are modifiable and associated with a poorer ObsQoR score and hence a poor quality of recovery after delivery. This data may then be used to educate women and manage expectations in the postpartum period, and help develop potential therapeutic interventions.

detailed_description.textblock:
Traditional postpartum outcome measures do not describe the patient experience or quality of recovery (QoR) after childbirth. A recent obstetric-specific recovery tool (ObsQoR-10) has been developed to assess the quality of recovery in patients in various mode of delivery on aspects of pain, drug side effects, comfort, control, ability to hold and feed the baby, independent mobilization and achievement of personal hygiene. However, this questionnaire is not yet validated in Asian population, especially in Chinese-speaking patients.
The investigators aim to investigate the validity, reliability, feasibility, and responsiveness of the Chinese translated version of ObsQoR-10. The investigators will first perform a pre-test in 10 patients, of which an interview will be conducted to seek for their feedback and suggestions. Modification of questionnaire will be done if necessary, followed by recruitment of 112 patients at postpartum day 1 to fill in the Chinese translated ObsQoR-10 and other questionnaires related to their mood, anxiety and pain. In this proposed study, the investigators hope to assess the quality of recovery after delivery in a local population that would take into account physiological and psychological parameters to better understand the recovery process after delivery. The investigators will identify risk factors, especially those that are modifiable and associated with a poorer ObsQoR score and hence a poor quality of recovery after delivery. This data may then be used to educate women and manage expectations in the postpartum period, and help develop potential therapeutic interventions.

primary_outcome.description: Repeat of ObsQoR-10-Chinese at 60 mins after the first postpartum day 1 ObsQoR-10-Chinese- Chinese and its correlation to the previous hour ObsQoR-10 (test-retest reliability)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between ObsQoR-10-Chinese and global health status
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of postpartum day 1 ObsQoR-10-Chinese scores with EQ-5D-3L-Chinese scores and global health Visual analog scale (VAS) (GHVAS; how good or bad is patient's health today, in her opinion, from 100 'Best imaginable health state' to 0 'Worst imaginable health state')
Correlation of postpartum day 1 ObsQoR-10-Chinese scores with good recovery (postpartum 1 GHVAS >=70mm) vs poor recovery (postpartum day 1 GHVAS < 70mm)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between ObsQoR-10-Chinese and length of hospital stay
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation of postpartum day 1 ObsQoR-10-Chinese scores with length of hospital stay (time from delivery to discharge)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time on the use of ObsQoR-10-Chinese
secondary_outcome.description: Time taken in minutes to complete the ObsQoR-10-Chinese questionnaire
